title: Feeling UPBEAT about growth: linking ROS gradients and cell proliferation.
abstract: Recent work in animals and plants suggests that reactive oxygen species (ROS) control cell proliferation. Reporting in Cell, Tsukagoshi et al. (2010) identify UPBEAT1 as a key transcription factor in the regulation of ROS distribution, which they find controls the transition between cell proliferation and differentiation in the Arabidopsis root.

authors.name: Darren M Wells
affiliations: Centre for Plant Integrative Biology, University of Nottingham, UK.

grants.agency: Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council
